summary: The Army Corps of Engineers manages the real estate at its infrastructure projects nationwide that businesses, state governments, and others can work with the Corps to use. For example, a business can lease land on a lake to run a marina. Users pay fees to the Corps to cover the costs of reviewing real estate use proposals and oversight—but some users have raised concerns about...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Better Alignment with Key Practices Would Improve Management of Real Estate Administrative Fees
